class-1-reason: This is an introductory paragraph that states the problem and describes the planned approach (simplifying numerator and denominator) without branching into uncertainty, checking, or trying alternatives. This is expository and strictly following the main solution path, thus General.

text:
**Numerator Simplification:**
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \sin A \left( 3 \cos^2 A + \cos^4 A + 3 \sin^2 A + \sin^2 A \cos^2 A \right) \\
&= \sin A \left[ 3(\cos^2 A + \sin^2 A) + \cos^2 A (\cos^2 A + \sin^2 A) \right] \\
&= \sin A \left[ 3(1) + \cos^2 A (1) \right] \\
&= \sin A (3 + \cos^2 A)
\end{aligned}
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph methodically simplifies the numerator by algebraic manipulation, following a logical and standard procedure toward rewriting the function.
class-2-reason: Performs detailed algebraic manipulation to simplify the numerator step by step; carries out mathematical operation as per plan.

text:
**Denominator Simplification:**
\[
\begin{aligned}
& \tan A \left( \sec A - \sin A \tan A \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{1}{\cos A} - \sin A \cdot \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{1 - \sin^2 A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \frac{\cos^2 A}{\cos A} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{\sin A}{\cos A} \right) \left( \cos A \right) \\
&= \sin A
\end{aligned}
\]
class-1-reason: This paragraph methodically simplifies the denominator step by step using algebraic transformations, confidently executing a planned approach.
class-2-reason: Executes successive algebraic steps to simplify the denominator, with stepwise calculations and transformations.
